intro: Melodinus laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth-leaved melodine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and the plant produces small, woody fruits containing seeds.
